dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Naim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Azmatullah Omarzai c Mohammad Naim b Taskin Ahmed 56 (71b 1x4 3x6 118m) SR: 78.87

dismissalComment.html: Omarzai reaches out and top edges a swipe, taken at long-off. Afghanistan's slow burn ends on 126. Taskin hung it wide and kept it slow, Omarzai tried to go over extra but couldn't lunge far across enough to get to it. Good 56 from him but no other mainstay for the visitors.

headshotImage.longCaption: Taijul Islam headshot

dismissalText.long: b Taijul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi b Taijul Islam 22 (54b 4x4 0x6 83m) SR: 40.74

dismissalComment.html: Hashmatullah misses the reverse and gets his leg stump rattled. Went too far across too early, committed to the shot but he couldn't adjust to the sharp angle of the length ball that straightened. He was beside the line and missed the ball completely. Timber hit. Risky shot with the team in trouble costs the skipper bigtime.

headshotImage.caption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shoriful gets the early breakthrough! Pitched on a length and going across Zadran, who pushed at it and only managed a thin edge. Mushfiqur gobbles it up and Shoriful is absolutely pumped

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gets him this time! Back of a length on leg and Rahmat just hung his bat out there. Ball takes the inside edge and settles into Mushfiqur's gloves

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: And he traps him in front! Angles it in from outside off and beats the inside edge. Hits him on the knee roll on the front pad.Nabi reviews it. HawkEye shows all three reds so Afghanistan lose the review.

headshotImage.caption: Abdul Rahman player headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdul Rahman player headshot

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, Taijul takes it at deep fine leg. Shoriful has four It was banged into the pitch, angled in towards the batter. Rahman swiveled and tried to get it fine but didn't attempt to hit it into the ground. It hit the edge above the sticker and flew to the right of Taijul, who moved across and lunged to complete a good catch. Shorful is pumped as another wicket gets thrown away.

headshotImage.caption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Short-ball ploy accounts for another wicket. Dug in short outside off, Gurbaz again tries to fetch it with a pull but manages only an edge, Mushfiqur has to leap high and take it above his head, but he makes no mistake. Afghanistan have lost their top order for under 15 runs here

Omarzai reaches out and top edges a swipe, taken at long-off. Afghanistan's slow burn ends on 126. Taskin hung it wide and kept it slow, Omarzai tried to go over extra but couldn't lunge far across enough to get to it. Good 56 from him but no other mainstay for the visitors.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 10 (22b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: Beaten on the sweep, confident lbw shout from Bangladesh is upheld. Afghanistan down on their last review, Najib takes it. Najib was on one knee and and missed the sweep, it hit him on the knee-roll of the front foot with off stump fully visible. The length ball pitched on leg, impact on middle and it's hitting middle and off. Visitors now out of reviews.

dismissalText.long: b Taijul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Zia-ur-Rehman b Taijul Islam 5 (30b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Crashes into off-stump! On a length on off, turns past the bat as Zia looks to go back to play it and hits the off-pole. Zia has done well so far, but this time Taijul gets the better of him. Omarzai has been happy to give him strike early in every over, leaving the debutant vulnerable here. It does bite Afghanistan eventually

dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman c Afif Hossain b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 11 (34b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 32.35

dismissalComment.html: Heaves across again, finds deep midwicket this time. Tossed up invitingly again to see if Mujeeb bites once more despite the six and the four earlier in the over. He goes for it but has to drag it from outside off. His front leg strode forward than across which didn't help the across, ball went straight to Afif

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi 39 (39b 5x4 0x6 46m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Shakib skies the pull and holes out to midwicket. Nabi wins the allrounder tussle and points to the keeper with an end-to-end grin. Tossed up on a shortish length outside off, Shakib tried to muscle it across but went too hard and got deceived. He was squared up as he swiped across, the ball took the lower part of the bat and was going to the diagonal right of the skipper, who ran from midwicket and slid into the grass to complete the catch

commentTextItems.html: Hridoy finishes the game with a strong cut. Not that short but sat up just outside off, Litton backed away and hit it on the move, got it through the gap in front of point

commentPostTextItems.html: That's the end of the second leg in Afghanistan's two-part tour to Bangladesh. They've come back strongly in the ODIs after being trounced in the Test. The first of the two T20Is will be on the 14th. See you then. Thanks for tuning in. Goodbye from me, Ekanth, my co-commentator, Abhimanyu Bose, and our scorer, Harshith Gowda.

Hashmat goes to collect the trophy as Afghanistan have won the series 2-1. He poses with a wide smile and then goes to the banner reading WINNER, he hands the trophy and goes to the side as cheers go up. More photos being taken of the players, the Afghan fans look thrilled too. Remember, it's the first time Afghanistan have won a series against Bangladesh.

Hashmatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan captain: Very happy with the series performance. Tough for us today, we were not complacent and will learn from the loss. Bangladesh played well, put us under pressure right from the beginning. I won't be part of the T20 squads, my best wishes for the players going in. Special thanks to the Afghanistan fans, They support us everywhere we go.

Litton Das, Bangladesh captain: Before the T20I series, this win helps the boys. They did a good job. Shoriful and Taskin used the new ball well, the spinners bowled well in the middle overs as well. All credit to the bowlers. Definitely confident going into the T20Is.

Fazalhaq Farooqi, POTS: Congratulations to everyone back. I struggled in the Sri Lanka series and we had a good prep camp. The problem in Sri Lanka was that I wasn't bowling in the right areas, I did that here and found success.

Shoriful Islam, POTM: Thanks to almighty. Says he's worked hard to come to this point. After the Ireland games, Hathurasinghe and Donald gave me some things to work on and I did that. When the bowling partnership goes well, the rhythm also improves. Taskin was also bowling very well which made it easier for me.

7:34pm: A convincing consolation win for Bangladesh to end the series. Afghanistan didn't show up with the bat but Farooqi's new-ball strikes gave some hope. But Litton stood tall and Shakib was proactive from the get go. He took the hosts from 28 for 2 after 7 overs to 89 for 3 off 17, his innings and the partnership went at a run a ball. Hridoy was busy at the crease and completed the win. Afghanistan's debutants got a bowl but there wasn't much to defend. Abdul Rahman's pace and Zia-ur-Rehman's ability to turn the ball were positives. But Shoriful's piercing spell and Litton's return-to-form fifty shone today.

commentTextItems.html: Length ball is punched back to the bowler
Length on the pads at 86kph, beats the flick and hits the pad. Impact was outside leg, so the appeal was stifled quickly
Wide on a length, keeps lower than Litton expected and beats him on the cut

commentPostTextItems.html: Rahat: "@Tasmeem I think Shakib's aggressive style deserves more chances. And besides, he always tries things before world cup. Playing big shots and overpowering opponents will be the key in upcoming World Cup. He never fails to deliver. He will this time too. Have faith."

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, Taijul takes it at deep fine leg. Shoriful has four It was banged into the pitch, angled in towards the batter. Rahman swiveled and tried to get it fine but didn't attempt to hit it into the ground. It hit the edge above the sticker and flew to the right of Taijul, who moved across and lunged to complete a good catch. Shorful is pumped as another wicket gets thrown away.

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 6 (22b 1x4 0x6 35m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: Short-ball ploy accounts for another wicket. Dug in short outside off, Gurbaz again tries to fetch it with a pull but manages only an edge, Mushfiqur has to leap high and take it above his head, but he makes no mistake. Afghanistan have lost their top order for under 15 runs here

dismissalText.long: lbw b Shoriful Islam

dismissalComment.html: And he traps him in front! Angles it in from outside off and beats the inside edge. Hits him on the knee roll on the front pad.Nabi reviews it. HawkEye shows all three reds so Afghanistan lose the review.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 10 (22b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: Beaten on the sweep, confident lbw shout from Bangladesh is upheld. Afghanistan down on their last review, Najib takes it. Najib was on one knee and and missed the sweep, it hit him on the knee-roll of the front foot with off stump fully visible. The length ball pitched on leg, impact on middle and it's hitting middle and off. Visitors now out of reviews.

dismissalText.long: b Taijul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi b Taijul Islam 22 (54b 4x4 0x6 83m) SR: 40.74

dismissalComment.html: Hashmatullah misses the reverse and gets his leg stump rattled. Went too far across too early, committed to the shot but he couldn't adjust to the sharp angle of the length ball that straightened. He was beside the line and missed the ball completely. Timber hit. Risky shot with the team in trouble costs the skipper bigtime.

dismissalText.long: c Taijul Islam b Shoriful Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Abdul Rahman c Taijul Islam b Shoriful Islam 4 (20b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, Taijul takes it at deep fine leg. Shoriful has four It was banged into the pitch, angled in towards the batter. Rahman swiveled and tried to get it fine but didn't attempt to hit it into the ground. It hit the edge above the sticker and flew to the right of Taijul, who moved across and lunged to complete a good catch. Shorful is pumped as another wicket gets thrown away.

dismissalText.long: b Taijul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Zia-ur-Rehman b Taijul Islam 5 (30b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Crashes into off-stump! On a length on off, turns past the bat as Zia looks to go back to play it and hits the off-pole. Zia has done well so far, but this time Taijul gets the better of him. Omarzai has been happy to give him strike early in every over, leaving the debutant vulnerable here. It does bite Afghanistan eventually

dismissalComment.html: Heaves across again, finds deep midwicket this time. Tossed up invitingly again to see if Mujeeb bites once more despite the six and the four earlier in the over. He goes for it but has to drag it from outside off. His front leg strode forward than across which didn't help the across, ball went straight to Afif

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Naim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Azmatullah Omarzai c Mohammad Naim b Taskin Ahmed 56 (71b 1x4 3x6 118m) SR: 78.87

dismissalComment.html: Omarzai reaches out and top edges a swipe, taken at long-off. Afghanistan's slow burn ends on 126. Taskin hung it wide and kept it slow, Omarzai tried to go over extra but couldn't lunge far across enough to get to it. Good 56 from him but no other mainstay for the visitors.

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi 39 (39b 5x4 0x6 46m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Shakib skies the pull and holes out to midwicket. Nabi wins the allrounder tussle and points to the keeper with an end-to-end grin. Tossed up on a shortish length outside off, Shakib tried to muscle it across but went too hard and got deceived. He was squared up as he swiped across, the ball took the lower part of the bat and was going to the diagonal right of the skipper, who ran from midwicket and slid into the grass to complete the catch
